bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, July 10, 1917

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to attend the U.S. Public Health Bureau conference.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, July 10, 1917
div1.opener:
J K C
PAB
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
July 10, 1917.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
C/O Passed Assistant Surgeon Mann,
Quantico, Va.
Sir:
div1.p:
The following Bureau telegram of the 6th instant
is hereby confirmed.

“Report at Bureau for conference Monday morning
July ninth.”

Upon completion of this duty, you will resume your studies
of malaria in the Southern States.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General.
J W K
The expenses incurred in carrying out the forego-
ing instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
R B
